page.title: 09LANDRAKE FARM CONTINUED
page.content: Mr.Brewer and his son who work Pound Farm,Landrake,have a long day.They start at 07.30 and continue until 18.00 every day.Their labourer works a 5 day week,viz.40 hours. The land was bought by the present owner's father in 1905,who described it as "greatful land" because it was so productive.Today fertilisers are added to maintain crop yields. The crops are grown for animal fodder -barley,turnip,kale and rape.The straw is used as bedding. There are very few trees on the farm,only twenty oaks in each of the two copses.There are of course hedgerow trees. As the farm buildings are on one side of the main road,it is necessary for the animals to be driven across to the other side.It becomes real country when sheep move through the village!
